topics.Architecture: Microservices, DDD, containere (Docker, Rocket...), event-sourcing, asynchronous services, fault tolerant systems, REST, dependency injection, web services without frameworks, web services without app servers, in-memory computing
topics.Mobile: Mobile first design, testing tools, multi-platform development, Apple Watch, iOS, Android, Windows Mobile
topics.Devops: Infrastructure as code, provisioning, continuous deployment
topics.Persistence: NoSQL, SQL, big data, cloud, grid
topics.Test code: Writing good tests, testing tools, continuous testing, TDD, BDD
topics.Programming: Paradigms, parallelism, typing, languages (C#, F#, Scala, Elixir, Clojure, etc.)
topics.Tools: Version control, build systems, SaaS, analysis (Sonar, R, etc.)
topics.Platforms and other: Cloud, Internet of Things, CMS, CRM, Office 365, EPiServer

submissions: A farewell to JavaScript? Looking at Scala.js
Building Front-end using Yeoman, Gulp & More!
Building Universal Windows Apps using the Unity game engine and Visual Studio
Cool new features with the ASP.NET 5 Framework
Do students require grunt to knockout jasmine?
Fancy Input Elements with Web Components
How stuff works - Big data metrics at CERN
How to apply design patterns in reality?
Instant, automated test feedback using NCrunch in Visual Studio
IoT á la Microsoft - Windows 10 on Raspberry PI
Mobile version of Estonian state portal eesti.ee
Negation Scope Detection for Twitter Sentiment Analysis
Quality challenges in digitalized world – testing is needed
The browser is the new fat client
Why you should learn Regular Expressions
DevOps og kontinuerlige leveranser i Oslo kommune
En Identity Management løsning for å håndtere 1,4 million medlemer og kunder for Coop
Hvordan gi en server et ansikt
Mine containere er lettere enn dine. Enklere uviklingsmiljø med Boot2Docker og Docker Compose.

collections.details: Johan Strid, Business Area Manager, Knowit Solutions, with a short talk about Knowit, trends, openness and other things.

health_care_servicebus.speaker: Don Janssen
health_care_servicebus.title: Building a healthcare service bus
health_care_servicebus.description: In a hospital lots of different systems are used and usually they do not work very well together. At the same time systems need to share information with each other and patients and authorities want information regardless of the system that stores the information. To solve this problem we are building a service bus for the county of Västerbotten, based on principles for domain driven architecture, SOA, REST and MicroServices, using .Net and Web API. The service bus handles routing, service discovery and has an engagement index that keeps track of patients and in which system they have data. Although every service is independent of the other a lot of functionality is the same for every service, therefore we created a framework existing of NuGet packages. As part of the project we also build a web portal on top of the service bus that makes the information about the patients accessible for the hospital's employees. In this talk I will discuss the challenges but most important the solutions we are working on to solve those integrations.

f#_whats_in_it_4_me.speaker: Toni Kaihola
f#_whats_in_it_4_me.title: F# : what's in it for me?
f#_whats_in_it_4_me.description: Join me on a whirlwind tour into the functional cousin of C#. We will cover many areas of the language, including the powerful type system and useful language constructs. You will get answers to the following questions: How can you code without nulls? What if you could do calculations with units of measurements such as m/s ? Using extension methods without extension methods, how? How can you get value equality for free? I have a lot of existing C# or VB code. Can I somehow benefit from F#? Finally we will explore tools that you can use to get acquainted with F# scripting and tools which you can use with your existing .NET projects and beyond.

git_enemy_friend.speaker: Christoffer Eliesen
git_enemy_friend.title: Git - From your worst enemy to your best friend
git_enemy_friend.description: In this talk I'll present my workflow when using git, including some advanced features, in order to showcase how you can get the most out of using this powerful tool.

managing_containers_kubernetes.speaker: Ole Bakstad
managing_containers_kubernetes.title: Managing your containers with Kubernetes
managing_containers_kubernetes.description: During the last few years containers have become a common word in the tech vocabulary. There are many providers that offer solutions for managing containers for example Google Cloud Platform, Amazon AWS and Mesosphere. This talk will introduce Kubernetes from Google, a orchestration tool that offer automated deployment, scaling and management of your containers. You will learn the core concepts and features of Kubernetes and gain insight in how it differs from similar solutions like Amazon Container Service or Mesosphere. I will also give a live demo of these features. The demo will show how to easily load balance between multiple container instances, auto scale your application and how to do canary releases and rolling upgrades with zero down time.

emerging_architectures.speaker: Jan Stenberg
emerging_architectures.title: Emerging Architectures
emerging_architectures.description: I will talk about architectures, that may be old, but gets an increasing interest today, because of their simplicity and how well they fit in the services and cloud world of today.

progressive_web_apps.speaker: Thuc Hoang
progressive_web_apps.title: Progressive Web Apps
progressive_web_apps.description: The future of the Web It's time to take back the way we use the Web and save countless of time developing applications.

make_a_programming_language.speaker: Martin Valen
make_a_programming_language.title: How to make a programming language
make_a_programming_language.description: Have you ever wanted to make your own programming language, but had to give up as you don't really know how to create one? So have I! But since I was working at CERN and they needed one, I had to hack it somehow. This talk will be a brief presentation on the grammars of programming languages, ASTs, compilers/interpreters, and other concepts you might know exist, but haven't really thought about how work. The level will be around where I was when I started the project: I knew how to use a couple of different languages, but compilers and interpreters where magical.

bimodal_business_intelligence.speaker: Pehr Benderix
bimodal_business_intelligence.title: Bimodal Business Intelligence – Data-driven innovation without loosing control
bimodal_business_intelligence.description: The digital era we are in has made data to the natural resource of our time. Organisations need to be able to harness data, transform it and derive insights and business value from it in order to survive in accelerating competition. This places increasing demands on organisations’ Business Intelligence to deliver innovative solutions enabling the business to create new and increased business value. Demands that that are hard to satisfy without compromising reliability and security in the existing BI landscape. Bimodal BI is about allowing two versions of BI to coexist in an organisation: BI Type I (Performance) and BI Type II (Innovation). The partition intends to give room for an explorative way of working with data-driven innovation while maintaining strict governance and control of daily business critical reporting and analysis work.

api_first.speaker: Jan Henrik Gundelsby
api_first.title: Skalering av store enterprise-systemer med API-first
api_first.description: Oslo kommune har over mange år bygget opp et stort felles applikasjonshotell og integrasjonsplattform ved hjelp av mikrotjenester. De kjører nærmere 200 mikrotjenester og er i stadig vekst på grunn av stor politisk satsning på digitale tjenester. Utviklerne jobber etter DevOps-prinsipper på grunn av alle de mange parallelle leveransene til alle kommunens 40 virksomheter. For å skalere plattformen med tanke på antall utviklere, utvidet last, økt mengde parallell aktivitet samt økte krav til time-to-market endrer kommunen nå både overordnet arkitekturmålbilde og strategi for utvikling av nye tjenester. Foredraget vil gi innblikk i veien frem til dagens situasjon, nåbildet og fremtidig målarkitektur.

react_angular.speaker: Olof Drevin
react_angular.title: React or angular2?
react_angular.description: When I say I work as a frontend architect the most common question I get is: Should we use React or Angular? In 15 minutes I'll present my answer based on my 7 years as a front end developer and 4 years as a front end architect, working for companies such as PwC, Unibet and Telia.

xamarin.speaker: Marit Hellestø
xamarin.title: Xamarin vs Native Development
xamarin.description: A short look at the pros and cons of Xamarin vs Native Mobile Development.

how_fast_is_ef.speaker: David Lund
how_fast_is_ef.title: How fast is EF really?
how_fast_is_ef.description: Ett kort tal om jämförelse om att använda databas via ADO.NET, EF6, kanske nHibernate och Dapper.NET. Det bygger på en del Tech spikes jag har gjort på S&P. Tänkte mest diskutera vad jag har gjort och ha en Github med koden så att andra kan testa själva.

intro_web_components.speaker: Christian Cederfjärd
intro_web_components.title: Introduction to Web Components
intro_web_components.description: A concise introduction to the Web Components specifications (Custom Elements, HTML Templates, Shadow DOM and HTML Imports) and how you can make use of them right now.

nosql.speaker: Andreas Hunderi
nosql.title: NoSQL - flattening data structures
nosql.description: Storing data in nosql is easy to get started with but dificult to master. I plan to talk about conventions for structuring data in nosql to minimize redundancy.

agile_cat.speaker: Krister Karto
agile_cat.title: Agile as a cat or just going through the motions.
agile_cat.description: Agile development is supposed to be the be all end all methodology to follow when developing software. Agile for us developers can range from being great, to the most painstaking experience ever. If the standup is taking forever and sprint planning consist of checking your phone more than the sprint board, something is wrong. The aim of this talk is to use my experience with both working and dysfunctional teams to pinpoint some pitfalls in agile and what can be done avoid them. Occasionally we need a reminder about what agile development is supposed to help us with to make sure we use it make our teams perform at its best.

http2.speaker: Asgeir Hølleland
http2.title: HTTP/2 - The new speedy gonzales of the web
http2.description: Why are we still using a protocol stuck in the 90s? You can always fallback to http/1.x if you really want that backwards compatibility. We might also have to undo some of the HTTP/1.x best practices that will cause performance degradation when loading our sites. There is even a part of the HTTP/2 specification that allows you to push content to the client before they'we even asked for it. HTTP/2 solves many issues but it also introduces some changes that we should know about. By the way, HTTP/2's official symbol is H2 (according to Surma @ Google) so you can go ahead and refer to HTTP/2 as H2.

react_story_book.speaker: Alexander Bjerkan
react_story_book.title: How to Develop and Document your React Components using React Storybook
react_story_book.description: In this lightning talk I will showcase React Storybook, an UI development tools for React components. By using the right plugins it can also be used to generate documentation and show the usage of your component library.

scratch.speaker: Martin Ivarsson
scratch.title: Kodboken och Scratch - skapandet av framtidens Linus Torvalds?
scratch.description: Introduktion till Kodboken och Scratch för att skapa förståelse hos barn och vuxna(!) vad programmering är.

baked_in_security.speaker: Ellen Weber
baked_in_security.title: Baked-in security
baked_in_security.description: In any IT project it is important to think about security right from the start. I'll talk about how agile teams can (and should!) do this and point out some helpful questions to go through.

rest_service_bus.speaker: Krister Karto
rest_service_bus.title: SignalR, Servicebus and REST mixed. What does it mean for your database?
rest_service_bus.description: Using several means of communication for your application can put your architecture to a test and why would you even do that? When using different sets of communication, you are also getting different sets of scopes where you're database is supposed to live. Handling this can be tricky. While developing for FjordTours we have seen the issues that can arise and figured out ways to solve them while trying to keep the code clean and understandable. Throwing MicroServices in the mix as well means the plumbing to set things up has to be repeated for every MicroService. How can this be solved with minimum code repetition.

angular_angle.speaker: Dennis Malmgren
angular_angle.title: Angular at an angle
angular_angle.description: If you build it they will come.

kotlin.speaker: Kennet Vuong
kotlin.title: Kotlin – Et språk for alt!
kotlin.description: Du har mest sannsynlig hørt JVM språk som Scala, Clojure, Java, Ceylon eller kanskje Jython eller Jruby? Hold deg fast, Kotlin er enda et nytt språk som kjøres på JVM’en. Kotlin er utviklet av Jetbrains og har endelig kommet ute av betafasen. Kotlin er et enkelt og statisk typet programmeringspråk som er fri for null pointer exceptions og 100% kompatibel med Java, og det kan brukes til mobil- og nettleser utvikling. Målet med denne lyntalen er å gi deg noen nye ideer om hvordan du kan ta i bruk Kotlin i ditt neste prosjekt.

hackathon_poc.speaker: Simon Nilsson
hackathon_poc.title: How to win a hackathon
hackathon_poc.description: ... or how to create a proof of concept in a day. Simon tells us about the benefits of Hackathons and how his team created a fully working app in a day and won the Spotify hosted hackathon Hack Out West.

scalable_css.speaker: Daniel Hallqvist
scalable_css.title: Practical tips for scalable CSS
scalable_css.description: "CSS takes a minute to learn, but a lifetime to master"", someone probably said some time. I know a lot of developers who dismiss deepening their knowledge in CSS because it's easy and they feel like they know everything already. Then why do most medium-to-larger web projects' stylesheets look like a big pile of s*it? I will run through a few practical tips that I think are handy when working with CSS and how they can keep the stylesheets leaner, more scalable and easier to maintain."

type_safe_elm.speaker: Runar Furenes
type_safe_elm.title: Type safe front-end development in Elm
type_safe_elm.description: Have you ever made changes in JavaScript and felt confident that you didn't break anything? Me neither. Elm is a functional language, which compiles to JavaScript. Elm code is fast, type safe, easy to refactor and highly testable. The Elm compiler provides understandable and helpful error messages, and ensures that no runtime exceptions are possible. This talk introduces the Elm language, followed by a step-by-step demo of how to implement a simple in-browser game in Elm.

neural_network.speaker: Astrid Tessem
neural_network.title: A beginner's guide to Convolutional Neural Networks
neural_network.description: In this talk I will provide an overview of what Convolutional Neural Networks are and how they work. I am planning to show a demo at the end of the talk.

styling_css.speaker: Alexander Bjerkan
styling_css.title: Local styling with CSS Modules
styling_css.description: CSS is well known for being applied globally. This very behaviour makes it difficult to scale, and it is challenging working with CSS on large and long-lasting codebases. In this talk, we will explore what CSS Modules are, what they intend to solve and how to use them.

universe_parallell_programming.speaker: Andreas Hunderi
universe_parallell_programming.title: Solving the mysteries of the universe with parallel programming
universe_parallell_programming.description: How can we harness the power of parallelism to tackle complex problems that can advance our understanding of the universe? The N-body problem is a collection of problems of how objects or particles interact with each other given an initial speed, a direction and a force that acts upon all other ojects (for instance gravity). This is relevant in many aspects of our lives today, like astrophysics, medicine or the simulation of weather patterns. I plan to talk about the N-body problem, and show what a serial and parallel implementation of the problem would look like.

mlaas_machine_learning.speaker: Anders Breivik
mlaas_machine_learning.title: MLaaS - Machine Learning for the rest of us
mlaas_machine_learning.description: What is Machine Learning as a Service? Which do I choose? How can I use it in my application? Machine learning has long been a somewhat academic discipline, its practitioners highly specialized. But with the advent of a new class of commoditized machine learning platforms, MLaaS, Machine Learning as a Service, is now available to all developers. MLaaS can be treated as a black box, giving developers the opportunity to dive into machine learning head first. Supply your own data, build a model using tools supported by your chosen MLaaS platform and train it using the well tested algorithms offered. When ready to dig deeper into the world of machine learning, most MLaaS platforms enables us to develop our own algorithms even better tailored to our data and models. This talk will show you the state of the art of MLaaS, what the different vendors offers, and where you best can put it to use in your applications.

containers_vs_microservices.speaker: Stellan Söderstrom
containers_vs_microservices.title: Containers and micro services - Architectural considerations and practical use case
containers_vs_microservices.description: Monolithic applications are good for small scale projects, but when you need to scale up usage and involve more teams, it quickly gets problematic. This talk describes how micro services and containers can be used to achieve a scalable architecture. Concrete examples and demonstrations will be used throughout the presentation.

personal_digital_security.speaker: Michael Johansen
personal_digital_security.title: Personal digital security
personal_digital_security.description: "You are one of the most significant security threats to your company. We all know we are going to fix better passwords / encryption / firewalls / etc. one day. Getting properly hacked is one of those things that is a lot more comfortable to prevent beforehand than to gather the shattered pieces afterwards. In this talk, we will take a practical approach to good personal digital security. We will start with the easy parts before drilling through the layers of security, down to the parts that are unpredictable and dangerous. Bring your laptop and a tin foil hat. Topics include: What it's like to get properly hacked. Using password managers. Operating system security. Browser security. Encryption, firewalls, factors, and other means of protection. All audiences. No code. All practical application. Perfect if you've watched the show ""Mr. Robot"" You will hopefully learn to, as they say, ""get your shit together"" when it comes to personal security."

tensorflow.speaker: Truls Fretland
tensorflow.title: Bruk av Google Tensorflow i et praktisk kundeprosjekt
tensorflow.description: Dyp læring (deep learning) har den siste tiden fått mye oppmerksomhet på grunn av flere gjennombrudd. Spesielt har Tensorflow rammeverket til Google blitt populært. I denne presentasjonen vil bruk av Google Tensorflow i et faktisk kundeprosjekt bli demonstrert.

aurelia_wf.speaker: Erlend Andresen
aurelia_wf.title: Modern Times - the Aurelia web framework
aurelia_wf.description: In this talk we will have look at the aurelia.io web framework and its take on the competitive web framework race. Web Components and a modular platform is key to be a competitive framework nowadays without being in your way as a developer. I am planning to demo some of the features Aurelia provides.

azure_functions.speaker: Fredrik Claesson
azure_functions.title: Azure Functions - Yet another event driven option
azure_functions.description: In Azure you can trigger on events by Queue triggers, blob triggers, Azure Service Bus subscribers, Event hub processor. What does Azure Functions add to the table? Whats the use case? Pros and cons?

spring_bootapp.speaker: Gunnar Velle
spring_bootapp.title: Overvåking av Spring Boot applikasjoner med Spring Boot Admin og Javamelody
spring_bootapp.description: Tenk om det hadde fantes et verktøy som lar deg enkelt få oversikten over alle spring boot applikasjonene dine, som lot deg få innblikk i noværande minne og prosessorbruk og som lot deg styre loggnivå runtime og i tillegg gi tilgang til JMX-konfigurasjon av applikasjonen. Det finnes og heiter Spring Boot Admin. Tenk om det også hadde fantes et verktøy som gir deg historiske oversikter over alt av ressursbruk i applikasjonene dine i tillegg til full logg over http-trafikk og sesjonsinformasjon med mye mer. Det finnes også og heter Javamelody. Denne presentasjonen viser kva vi gjorde i DSB-prosjektet med bruk av Spring Boot Admin og Javamelody ved hjelp av en egen applikasjon som samler alt av overvåkingsdata på en plass og som gir verdifull innsikt i kjøremiljøet ditt.

shadow_dom.speaker: Johannes Giske
shadow_dom.title: Shadow DOM
shadow_dom.description: An introduction to the Shadow DOM which is becomming available in newer browsers and some of the new possibilities this enables in the near future.

chrome_extension_browseit.speaker: Michael Johansen
chrome_extension_browseit.title: A Chrome extension called BrowseIt
chrome_extension_browseit.description: A practical talk about Chrome extensions, exemplified by an extension used as an internal onboarding tool in Knowit Objectnet.

microsoft_hololens.speaker: Christian Egeberg
microsoft_hololens.title: Programming the Microsoft HoloLens
microsoft_hololens.description: What makes the Microsoft HoloLens different from other Virtual Reality headsets like Oculus Rift and HTC Vive? What can you use a HoloLens for now, and which direction is it moving forward? We'll look at ways to program the HoloLens, and API support for world coordinates, gestures, gaze, voice, spatial sound and spatial mapping. Yes, we'll bring a HoloLens to KDS 2016.

sp_framework_react_office365.speaker: Toni Kaihola
sp_framework_react_office365.title: SharePoint Framework, ReactJS and Webpack in Office 365 development
sp_framework_react_office365.description: There's something afoot in SharePoint land! Come with me as I explore the new client-side SharePoint Framework, it's development tools as well as ReactJS and Webpack. The session will include quick introductions to ReactJS and Webpack, after which we'll see how to create your first SharePoint Framework webpart.

oracle_apex.speaker: Ove Holm
oracle_apex.title: Oracle Apex 5.0 - Rapid GUI development
oracle_apex.description: Oracle recently released version 5 of their Application Express product, a free GUI well suited for any system that uses an Oracle database. Currently, many customers are looking to replace their old Oracle Forms systems (which has reached End-Of-Life) and Apex is a fast-start, no-license fee environment which leverages existing PL/SQL-competence and can scale to enterprise application size.

drones_with_js.speaker: Anders Breivik
drones_with_js.title: Programming mini drones with JavaScript
drones_with_js.description: In this talk you will learn how to program popular over-the-counter flying mini drones with JavaScript for fun and profit. Well, mostly for fun, but while having fun you can learn JavaScript, node.js, physical computing, Internet of Things and other stuff that surely can be profitable. Cylon.js is a node.js based JavaScript framework for robtics and physical computing. It supports an extensive range of hardware, from remote controlled toys to IoT devices. Cylon.js is great for abstracting away the annoying aspects of hardware coding, leaving the fun part: seeing your code bridge the gap from the digital to the physical world. There might be live coding, and if the demo gods favour us, a live drone show!
